raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The individual shows a strong preference for high-quality entertainment, as evidenced by consistently high ratings (averaging 4.6-4.9) across various products. They particularly enjoy dramas, suspenseful narratives, and comedies with complex storylines and engaging character development. Themes of violence, alcohol use, and explicit content appear frequently, indicating a willingness to engage with mature content. 

Quality is prioritized, as reflected in near-unanimous five-star ratings, suggesting the consumer seeks well-produced media with strong casts and engaging storytelling. Despite a clear appreciation for high-quality content, there is no evident price sensitivity; the focus appears to be solely on the quality and entertainment value rather than cost considerations. 

Overall, this consumer demonstrates a genuine preference for gripping stories featuring ensemble casts, preferably in the genres of drama or comedy that integrate darker themes, while showing no inclination towards budget constraints in their purchases.

target_interaction.title: Terrible Ending
target_interaction.text: I love Angie Harmon, that’s why I bought this movie.  Left me hanging and not in a good way, not even a cliff hanger… just the end.  Make a part 2 and finish the. Movie.
